identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) in Patients With Solid Tumors Harboring an NRG1 Fusion (eNRGy)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase I/II Study of MCLA-128, a Full Length IgG1 Bispecific Antibody Targeting HER2 and HER3, in Patients With Solid Tumors (eNRGy)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase I/II, open-label, multi-center, multi-national, dose escalation, single agent study to assess the safety, tolerability, PK, PD, immunogenicity and anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) in patients with solid tumors harboring an NRG1 fusion (eNRGy)
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Study Design :

This open label (all participants know the identity of the study drug), multicenter (more than one study site), first-in-human study consisting of 2 parts. Part 1 is a dose escalation and Part 2 is a dose expansion cohort. Part 1 has been completed.

Part 2 new patient populations examined:

* Group F: Patients with NSCLC with documented NRG1 fusion
* Group G: Patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma with documented NRG1 fusion
* Group H: Patients with any other solid tumor with documented NRG1 fusion

For these new patient populations, Part 2 will further characterize the safety and tolerability of the selected dose level of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128), as well as assessment of CBR, defined as the proportion of patients with a CR, PR or durable SD (SD for at least 24 weeks in duration). For the new patient populations, overall response rate (ORR) and duration of response (DOR) will be described.

The study consists of 3 periods: Screening period (up to 28 days prior to the first dose of study drug); Treatment period (treatment cycles of 28 days); and Follow Up period (through 30 days after the last dose and quarterly checks for survival data for up to 2 years). Participants' safety will be monitored throughout the study.

armGroups.label: Part 2 Pancreatic adenocarcinoma harboring NRG1 fusion
armGroups.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

armGroups.label: Part 2 NSCLC cancer harboring NRG1 fusion
armGroups.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

armGroups.label: Part 2 Solid tumour (basket) harboring NRG1 fusion
armGroups.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

interventions.name: zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
interventions.description: full length IgG1 bispecific antibody targeting HER2 and HER3

primaryOutcomes.measure: Objective overall response rate (ORR) as per local investigator's assessment
primaryOutcomes.description: Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining objective overall response rate (ORR)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of response per RECIST v1.1 as per local Investigator's assessment.
primaryOutcomes.description: To assess durability of anti-tumor activity of MCLA-128 in patients with NRG1 fusions as assessed locally

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Overall response rate as per central review
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the anti-tumor response of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) by RECIST v1.1 as assessed centrally

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR) of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) assessed locally and centrally
secondaryOutcomes.description: CBR assessed as the proportion of patients in whom a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) is observed (where SD duration is a minimum of 24 weeks) by RECIST v1.1 .

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of Response as per central review
secondaryOutcomes.description: To assess durability of anti-tumor activity of MCLA-128 in patients with NRG1 fusions as assessed centrally

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to response per RECIST v1.1. as per local Investigator's assessment.
secondaryOutcomes.description: To assess time to onset of response in patients with NRG1 fusions as assessed locally

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to response per RECIST v1.1. as per central review
secondaryOutcomes.description: To assess time to onset of response in patients with NRG1 fusions as assessed centrally

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize the safety and tolerability of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with Adverse Events (AE) and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
Assess the volume of distribution of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Volume of distribution at steady state [Vss]
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the volume of distribution of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) at steady state

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t [AUC0-t]
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t \[AUC0-t\] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: area under the concentration versus time curve [AUC0-∞]
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the area under the concentration versus time curve \[AUC0-∞\] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
Assess the time to reach maximum concentration \[tmax\] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of anti-drug antibodies against zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the Incidence of anti-drug antibodies against zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
Assess serum titers of anti-drug antibodies
